title: toyboys secret marriage 91 year
story: Toyboys secret marriage to -year-old woman sees grieving family lose £,Joan Blasss son and daughter became worried when a man  years younger became fiends with her and moved in with her five months before her deathJoan Blass died in March  at the age of  Image: Glen Minikin Daily MailByLucy MarshallGraeme Murray:,  Mar |commentsA toyboyaposs secret marriage to a -year-old bride seen a family lose £,. Joan Blass died in March , sparking the beginning of a nightmare for her family. Her son and daughter became worried when a man  years younger became friends with her and moved in with her five months before her death. Daughter Daphne Franks, of Skipton, North Yorkshire was concerned because her mum was not aware he lived in her home and did not no know his name or where he was from.She told LeedsLive : Mum never seemed to know he lived there.She was asking, aposwhat is his name  Where did he come from apos At this stage, Joan could barely recall her own name, let alone that of her new toyboy.  When she died, the family discovered that Mr Folan had married her and the dementia sufferer was still wearing the wedding ring from her late husband Ron. Ron died in  after  years of the couple being together. Her new marriage meant her two children Daphne,  ,and Michael, , lost out on their £, inheritance because the registry office ceremony annulled her will. Daphne discovered three days after her motheraposs death that she had been married in a civil ceremony at Leeds Town Hall. Speaking to Predatory Marriage UK, Daphne said: We had contacted my motheraposs GP on so many occasions, the police, the social services, and had also taken legal advice and had been told that she could not make another will or marry again because of her severe dementia. Taking the toyboy to court The marriage meant the will Mrs Blass had drawn up, naming her two children as beneficiaries, was void and she died intestate, meaning her new husband automatically inherited her assets. Daphne decided to take legal action after Folan, now , took over the funeral arrangements. The hearing lasted four days but sadly for the family, siding with Mr Folan. Mrs Franks and her relatives were left with a £, legal bill. On top of that, none of Joanaposs relatives were invited to her funeral and she was buried in an unmarked grave.  Pushing for change Since the nightmare the family have been pushing for action to stop predatory marriages. Predatory Marriage UK aims to reform marriage laws and procedures to protect people with dementia. In  Fabian Hamilton, MP for Leeds North East, called on the PM to stop elderly and vulnerable people being preyed upon by tricksters leading to families losing their inheritance. Mr Hamilton first began campaigning on the matter a few years ago after hearing a story he could “hardly believe was possible in modern Britain”. He said: “It’s not good enough for a registrar simply to say that because one of the participants in the marriage ceremony was smiling at the time, that meant consent was happily given. The family have been working with Hourglass charity to welcome round-the-clock help. Mrs Franks said a   helpline would make an absolute dference. The Frank family have recently been working with Hourglass charity to get round-the-clock help for those affected by elder abuse. Ms Franks said a   helpline would make an absolute dference. She added thatshe had known about a helpline before she would have definitely rung it. The Hourglass charity said it was moving Its helpline to a   operation because more than a quarter of the calls it received went unanswered during out of hours. It said Home Office funding meant it was now able to extend its service to make sure calls were being answered day and night. Richard Robinson, Hourglass CEO, said: Thankfully we are increasingly aware of other forms of abuse like child abuse and domestic violence, but the abuse of older people remains in the shadows even though it affects millions. So many people are suffering and donapost know where to turn for help. title: uk covid cases more double
story: UK Covid cases more than double in a month as deaths rise by % to The UK has recorded another , Covid cases today, a drop of nearly % on this time last week, though virus-related deaths have surged by % to  - but an increase compared to last month, just two days before Covid measures were scrapped in EnglandA member of staff at University Hospital Monklands attends to a Covid-positive patient on the ICU ward Image: Getty ImagesByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe UK recorded another , Covid cases today and  new deaths. Thataposs a drop in infections of nearly % compared to last Tuesday when it hit ,, but a % rise in virus-related fatalities. Despite the encouraging drop off in positive cases in just seven days, itaposs still over double what it was this time last month - just two days before Covid measures were scrapped in England. Boris Johnson lted virus restrictions on Thursday, February , and on the previous Tuesday just , new infections were officially recorded.In spite of an initial marginal dip the following week when the daily number dropped to ,, it quickly soared by % the following Tuesday to ,. The figures then rocketed again a week later by %. Downing Street was warned it was taking a major risk in introducing its Living with Covid plan last month.  It means those who test positive are no longer required to self-isolate, but are advised to stay at home and avoid contact with others for at least five days. Masks are also no longer legally required in public. As of April , lateral flow tests will no longer be free, except for over-s and over-s with weakened immune systems.  This time last year on Tuesday, February ,  the UK recorded just , new cases. However, England was just emerging from its latest lockdown - with the Prime Minister unveiling his roadmap for lockdown easing the day before on February . At that time in , schools in England had reopened, recreation in outdoor public spaces was allowed between two people - but the stay at home order remained in effect.  Following a Christmas  easing of rules, despite the highly transmissible B iant - first identied in Kent - running rampant, the Government had been forced to throw the country back into full lockdown for months. In terms of deaths, the UK recorded  last Tuesday and  the same day the previous week. On Tuesday, March , the figure was  and  two days before the new plan was brought in.  This time last year, on Tuesday, February , , a total of  deaths were recorded - a dference of % on todayaposs toll. And considering the UK had been in lockdown since the start of the previous month, it shows how far the country has come in breaking the link between infection and death. This is in no small part thanks to the rollout of the vaccine programme.  As of the latest figures released on Monday, a total of ,, people have had their first jab in the UK. Those having had both total ,, and boosters ,,.The UK is currently contending with yet another new iant the BA. strain of Omicron, which is said to be more transmissible than its predecessor. Hybrid versions of the coronavirus that combine genes from the Delta and Omicron iants - dubbed “Deltacron” - have been identied in patients across Europe and the United States, researchers have said.It has been officially confirmed as a new iant. According to analysis of Deltacron’s genetic code, its “backbone” is derived from the Delta iant while its spike – the part of the virus that attaches itself to human cells – is from Omicron.  In fact, Professor Adrian Esterman, an epidemiologist and biostatistican, said the iant could be one of the most infectious diseases the world has ever seen.He said it is up to six times more transmissible than the original strain of Covid - hence the up surge in new cases. BA.aposs R number, the rate at which it can spread, was at  last week, compared to . for the original virus. But it appears to be far less deadly than previous strains. news uk-news wanted-man-abseils-down-block-"Lancashire: Man abseils down residential building to escape policeByMark BranaganRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar This is the amazing moment a wanted man web slings his way down a block of flats like Spider-Man to give cops the slip. The fugitive pulled off his escape act when officers turned up at the tower block in Preston, Lancashire, to arrest him. The video shows the track suited escape artist climb out of a four-storey window before using ropes to shimmy down towards Samuel Street on the Callon estate. He appears to use dog leads or belts tied together to lower himself halfway down before leaping from the second floor.  He hits the ground hard, landing next to one of the police cars, before hurling himself over a metal fence and fleeing on. Lancashire Police have named the suspect as Jamie Carlisle and say he is wanted in connection with threats to damage property in the city. The hunt is under way for the nimble-limbed -year-old and police have appealed for anyone with information to get in touch.  A police spokesman said: “Officers attended an address off Samuel Street, Preston, yesterdayas part of our enquiries to trace wanted man Jamie Carlisle. Carlisle is wanted in connection with making threats to damage property following reports of a public order earlier this month. “We are aware of a video circulating on social media showing a man climbing down from a fourth story window and jumping to the ground in order to evade police.  “We are continuing to actively search for Carlisle and we would urge anyone with information to contact us. Carlisle could be violent and we would advise the public not to approach him but instead call us with his location and a description of his clothing.”Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Lancashire PolicePolice carBurglaryCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman 59 noticed skin turning
story: Woman, , noticed her skin turning yellow before receiving horror cancer diagnosisSahar Saleh had noticed her skin “turn yellow” before she sought medical advice and was diagnosed with a rare form of cancerSahar, who died from cancer in March , aged  Image: Sami DabbaghByAaron CurranAlice PeacockNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA woman who noticed her skin turn yellow received a devastating diagnosis of a rare form of cancer soon after. Sami Dabbagh, who lives in St Helens, Liverpool, said his aunt Sahar Saleh had noticed her skin “turn yellow” before the then -year-old was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer. While Sahar was given the all clear in , he cancer ed, and she died in March , aged .Sami toldthe Livepool Echothat the change in Sahar’s skin colour was what triggered the diagnosis.What triggered the diagnosis is she was jaundiced, so her skin was essentially going yellow, and that is what led her to go to the doctors, this was around six years ago,” he said.  She was having treatment for cancerous tumours but at that point there was an opportunity to do quite a risky operation called a Whipple procedure, which involved taking part of the organs affected by the tumours out. The procedure has a survival rate of between  and %, but Saharaposs operation was successful. This allowed the keen cyclist to live a healthy and active le for several years.  Sami added: It was like she had a new lease on le, it sounds a bit cheesy but it was certainly like a second chance at le. She was only in her s around this time, and she was generally a very bubbly, eccentric, active person.  To remember his aunt, and also help support the charity which provided amazing care for her, Sami is running four marathons across four dferent countries this year. Sami will raise money for Macmillan Cancer Support. The charity provided vital care for his aunt during her illness, as well as for Palestine Children’s Relief Fund. news uk-news woman-screams-jet-workers-face-"Jet passenger removed from flight after hitting fellow travellerByDanya BazaraaSenior News ReporterRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments This is the shocking moment an irate woman screams in the face of Jet flight staff and slaps a fellow passenger after her foul behaviour lead staff to chuck her from the plane.The young woman, who is thought to be from the Kirklees area of West Yorkshire, paces up and down the aisle, screams and shouts at staff on the flight that was meant to fly straight from Manchester Airport straight to Antalya, in Turkey. The plane had to be erted after she became aposdisruptiveapos and reportedly slapped other passengers. One female passenger on board has told The Mirror how her young daughter was left traumatised by the womanaposs foul behaviour and fighting. The Jet flight to Antalya left Manchester at around .am on Monday and was due to arrive in Turkey around four and a half hours later.It was erted to Vienna and landed there around .am, reports the Manchester Evening News . In the video, the irate passenger is seen screaming in the face of a unormed staff member at the front of the plane.  As other flight staff gather around her to aid their colleague, it looks as though she lashes out with her hands against someone seated in the first row. A member of staff can be seen telling her to aposstand backapos, to which she replies: I am back. Sort your head out you. The airline worker says: You are not doing yourself any favours. She replies: Yourapose not doing yourself any favours either. So what have I done  Donapost touch me, donapost ****ing touch me. She adds: What have I done  What have I done wrong on this flight, eh  See, you havenapost got an answer.  Another passenger, who asked only to be named by her first name, Emma, told The Mirror it was about  minutes into the flight when the disruption started. She said: The flight attendant was trying to calm her down. She was being really loud and arguing with the passenger in front of her. That went on for about  minutes. They gave her notice that any more trouble and further action would be taken and were telling her aposweaposre not here to be horrible to anybodyapos. She was not having any of it. She was aggressive and swearing, it was not a nice experience. You didnapost dare look at her. At one point I walked down the aisle to go to the toilet with my little girl and she said aposwhat the f*** are you looking at  Go on, have a f***ing look all of you.apos  Emma said the ‘disruptive’ passenger was “ranting and raving”. She said people made her her aware there were children on board when she was “shouting and swearing” but she “retaliated” and swore more.“She lunged forward and slapped a woman around the face,” Emma added.“A guy got up and calmed her down, who I think had just qualied as a police officer. “It was announced on the tannoy we were making an emergency landing. We landed in Vienna and stayed for about  minutes. “The flight was a nightmare from start to finish. “I was frightened. My daughter was panicking.“Nobody wanted to intervene because they didn’t want to get in trouble”. A witness on the flight said: This was a truly horrible flight for myself and my  children. My little girl was traumatised at the ladyaposs foul behaviour fighting and shouting and swearing. Sheaposs now refusing to fly home due to this it scared her so much. A man can be seen shaking his head at the womanaposs behaviour. Another video clip appears to show the moment armed police officers escorted the woman from the plane. One passenger can be heard to shout: Wait til you get the bill love. Others are shouting bye bye as the woman is led away by armed officers.  A text sent by Jet to passengers onboard the flight shortly before pm said: Hello, we are sorry that due to the disruptive behaviour of a fellow passenger, your flight has been erted to Vienna. We are working on a situation to get you on your way as soon as possible. The flight arrived at its original destination, Antalya, just after pm - one hour and  minutes later than scheduled. A Jet spokesperson said: “We can confirm that flight LS from Manchester to Antalya erted to Vienna yesterday so that a disruptive passenger could be offloaded. As a family friendly airline, we take a zero tolerance approach to disruptive behaviour.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON JetCrimePlanes" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: you covid cold hay fever
story: Do you have Covid, a cold or hay fever  Experts share how to tell symptoms apartWith symptoms of Covid-, the common cold and hay fever overlapping, it can be hard to tell which youve got. Here health experts explain how to tell the dferenceIt can be hard to know whether you have Covid, a common cold or hay fever Image: Getty ImagesByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Mar |commentsCovid cases are rising in the UK, and with free lateral flow tests being scrapped from April , itaposll be harder to knowyou have the virusyou donapost have the usual symptoms. Although Covid cases are surging, there are also other seasonal illnesses around which could cause you to experience similar symptoms, such as the common cold and flu. And now spring has officially sprung, hay fever is being thrown into the mix. Itaposs estimated that almost half of the UKsuffer from hay fever, according to AllergyUK, but with overlapping symptoms it becomes hard to dferentiate between a common cold or even Covid-. Here, with the help of health experts, we explain the dference in symptoms, and what you should look out for. How to tellyouaposve got a cold or Covid  With so many overlapping symptoms, it can be hard to dferentiate between a cold and Covid.Firstly, be aware of the main symptoms of Covid. According to the NHS, they are: A high temperature A new, continuous cough A loss or change to your sense of smell or tasteThe common cold can have similar symptoms. According to the NHS, they are:A blocked or runny noseA sore throat Headaches Muscle aches Coughs Sneezing A raised temperature Pressure in your ears and face Loss of taste and smellDeep Patel, LloydsPharmacy’s Vaccination Services Manager, further explained the dference between a cold and Covid. He said: People can confuse a common cold and Covid- as they’re both respiratory illnesses, but they are caused by dferent viruses. Colds generally do not cause serious health problems such as pneumonia or bacterial infections, and they rarely lead to hospital care. Typical cold symptoms are sneezing a lot and a runny nose, sometimes you’ll also have a high temperature of .C or more. Unlike a cold the symptoms we see with Covid- tend to be much more severe and often include a dry and continuous cough, loss of taste and shortness of breath. You’re also more likely to have a fever with Covid- than with a cold but symptoms y for people infected with the corona virus. If you think you have symptoms of Covid- we recommend you take a lateral flow test as soon as possible.” Whataposs the dference between hay fever and Covid   Hay ever is usually worse between late March and September, especially when itaposs warm. According to the NHS, the main symptoms, similar to a cold and Covid, are:Sneezing and coughing A runny or blocked nose Itchy, red or watery eyes Itchy throat, mouth, nose and ears Loss of smell Pain around your temples and forehead Headache Earache Feeling tiredHighlighting the dference between hay fever and Covid, Dr Belinda Grfiths from The Fleet Street Clinic in London, said: Hay fever is an allergic condition which predominantly affects the nose and eyes. Common symptoms include itchy, red, watering eyes, sneezing and a running nose, which may feel blocked. In the majority of cases, excluding asymptomatic cases, Covid- tends to make you feel unwell. The most common symptoms remain to be a new continuous cough, loss of sense of taste and smell and a high-temperature. It is possible for the symptoms of both to overlap. For example, you can have a postnasal drip with hay fever, which can make you cough, but in general, the symptoms of hay fever tend to be milder than that of Covid. If the symptoms improve with an antihistamine or a nasal spray, it is likely to be hay fever. If they don’t improve it may be worse considering the symptoms are something . If you are not sure, or you have a temperature, loss of sense of smell and taste, a cough and general malaise, always check with your GP or call . You can take a rt-PCR test to exclude Covid-. How to find outyou have a cold, hay fever or Covid  The only way to know for sureyou have Covid is to do a test. At the moment the advice stands thatyou have Covid symptoms you shoulder order a free PCR test from the government website. You should do thisyou have any of the main symptoms of Covid. From April PCR tests will no longer be available, except for a small number of at-risk groups. More details of this will be announced in due course. title: crumpets cause debate no one
story: Crumpets cause debate as no one can agree on what theyre actually calledA heated debate has been sparked online over the humble crumpet as people from around the world have shared the dferent names they call them - and no one can agree on the correct oneWhat do you call these Image: Getty ImagesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsWhen it comes to crumpets, the only conversation we usually have about them is what topping to slather on when theyaposre fresh out of the toaster - do you go for a simple spread of butter or get a bit more creative But it seems thereaposs a lot more to be said about the small bread, as a recent debate on Twitter has shown. A social media user named Phil Sledge has caused a stir after sharing a snap of two buttered crumpets online and asking: What are these called where you live  Thousands of people have liked the tweet, with hundreds replying - and it seems many arenapost able to agree on the name for the savoury snack.Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Some people were adamant they were crumpets while others called them pikelets and some thought they were English muffins. The official Deliveroo Twitter replied to Philaposs post, writing: Itaposs crumpets and any other answer is just plain wrong. Thanks for coming to our TED talk. While Heinz wrote: We call them circles of joy. Another posted: I call them crumpets but my we calls them pikelets. We were brought up in villages less than tree miles apart so Iaposve no idea why she calls them by the wrong name. Someone  said: Those are English Muffins here in Canada. I like mine toasted, buttered and covered in homemade preserves. A dferent user admitted: I always knew them as pikelets until fairly recently when they arrived in the supermarkets as crumpets. Either way, they are good with lots of butter and sometimes Marmite as well. In an attempt to clear some of the confusion, a former bakery worker explained why some people might call them pikelets, sharing a photo of a spikey tool used in baking. They added: That was my first job at a bakery... putting the holes in crumpets. We used a special tool called a apospikeletapos hence the confusion. I later progressed to the more specialised job of putting the hole in doughnuts, for which I used a larger tool called a aposdunkerapos.What do you call them  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON FoodViral" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: friends themed house up sale
story: Friends-themed house is up for sale - with Central Perk living room and Monicas kitchenA house has gone on the market that is bound to impress fans of Friends as it features decor just like that seen in the show, with a Central Perk-themed living room and kitchen like MonicasThe house is perfect for Friends fans Image: Kennedy News Better Homes and Gardens ZillowByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterBen Thompson:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsIf thereaposs one apartment from TV that many people have always lusted after, itaposs Monica and Rachelaposs one in Friends.The New York apartment with the iconic purple door continues to be popular long after the show ended - so much so that a whole house inspired by the show has just gone on the market. The two-bedroom property in Houston, Texas, is up for ,and features a Central-Perk themed living room, a mural of the fountain from the opening credits and a replica of Monicaaposs kitchen.Built in  the house is bound to give fans of the sitcom a much-needed hit of nostalgia and allow them to live like any of the six friends.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Each space in the home has a nod to the show, with a crushed velvet sofa in the lounge for your best pals to sink into and enjoy a mug of coffee, as well as a remarkably le-like mural of the shopaposs windows looking out onto a tree and a yellow NYC cab apparently parked up outside. In the next room, thereaposs an impressive mural of the water fountain is emblazoned across the wall along with the showaposs logo. On the staircase is a humorous drawing of Ross yelling aposPivot!apos, a nod to the hysterical scene where Ross, Rachel and Chandler try to get a sofa up a flight of stairs with great dficulty. Meanwhile, true fans will spot the lilac and blue colour scheme in the kitchen, in tribute to Monica and Rachelaposs kitchen.  The Zillow listing for the property reads: F·R·I·E·N·D·S - If you loved the TV show, then youaposll love this house! There are wall murals reminiscent of scenes from the show along with decor and furnishings to make you feel like youaposre there. The current owners didnapost aposmonkeyapos around when paying attention to details. So have fun looking around and stay alert for those details! Start your day with breakfast prepared in Monicaaposs Kitchen. After a day of foosball or hanging out with friends at Central Perk, it might be time to check the local entertainment.  This location holds more fun with bars and restaurants within walking distance of the home. White Oak Bayou Greenway Trail is also nearby. In case you would rather drive, the garage has a -volt charger for Tesla. This is a place for having fun and making new memories. Could this be the home for your next chapter  Many Friends fans loved the house but a few other online commentators werenapost so sure. One wrote: Itaposs funny, and I would wager there is a huge market of unmarried women in their mid-s who would be interested in this townhome. Another admirer tweeted: I would buy this and not change a single thing. While someone  asked:What is it that compels so many people to make theme homes like this  Does it really bring them so much joy to live in a theme park    What happens when they get tired of the franchise  A dferent user added: Iaposd buy this but my jobaposs a joke, Iaposm broke and my love leaposs DOA.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: grandad 38 1500 tattoos 98
story: Grandad, , has , tattoos on % of his body including his eyeballs and gumsMarcelo Bboy, , has more than , tattoos across almost his entire body with plans to add more to his leg and "private area" which are not yet covered in inkMarcelo has several modications, including black eye balls and teeth replaced with nickel ones Image: mediadrumworld @marcelobboyByAntony ThrowerNews ReporterJosie Adnitt:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A grandad says he has spent nearly £, getting tattoos all over his body, including his eyeballs.Model Marcelo Bboy, , , got his first aged  and since then has added around , across his entire body.As well as turning himself into an artwork, he has also had a number of body modications including having his tongue split in half to resemble a snake’s and replacing all of his teeth with nickel ones.The tattoos which garner the most attention however is the black ink he has added to his eyes and gums. Marcelo, from Bocaiuva, Brazil, said: Today, people look at me with curiosity and interest. I donapost hear many bad comments about how I look.Women are very enchanted by my tattoos and modications and I like all of my tattoos - there isnapost one that I could say was my favourite.My kids are totally cool with my tattoos and my daughter already has some of her own. Iaposm supportive of whatever they do. “The eyes are the modication that is most popular with people because many people are curious about how to get their eyes tattooed and have questions about the risk of going blind. I wasnapost worried about going blind because I understand the process - the eye pigmentation is only done in the white part of the eye. I have about % of my body tattooed and I think I have spent around ,in expenses on tattoos and body modications.” Marcelo, who has two children and one grandchild, now works as an artistic model and actor, as well as attending tattoo events as a public figure.  His most recent operation was inserting implants which are inserted under the skin for decorative purposes in his left arm. Marcelo has no plans on slowing down however as he has more he wants done after he has filled the last remaining areas on his body not covered with ink. He added: I only have a few spaces left without tattoos like intimate areas and some small spaces on my leg, but I plan to get them tattooed soon too. I was twenty-two when I realised I wanted more tattoos, and since then I have covered myself in them.  The advice I would give to those who want a lot of tattoos is to know exactly what they want and to work in the tattoo industry.”Earlier this week dad Karac Smith, , revealed how he has no problem getting a job despite being entirely covered in £, worth oftattoos , including all over hisface .He said that his extreme body inking actually helps him find employment, once even getting seven job offers in a week. The married dad-of-four, from Sheffield, got his first tattoo when he was  and has been employed ever since. He estimates that  percent of his body is now covered in tattoos, with only his cheeks and nose untouched from the ink machine. I always get comments like aposI bet you canapost find a jobapos but Iaposve never been out of work. title: i huge spider living house
story: I have a huge spider living in my house - guests hate it but I wont kill itA woman from Australia has said she has a giant huntsman spider that lives on her ceiling - and even though it freaks out her house guests, she refuses to kill itThe womans eight-legged friend has been creeping out her house guestsImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsFor those of us who canapost stand spiders, the thought of letting one stay in your home is unimaginable - as weaposd sooner watch our property burn to the ground than stay in the same room as one. Butyou donapost mind the eight-legged creatures, letting them roam free on your walls and ceilings might seem like a great idea, especiallytheyaposre going to snack on insects like mosquitos that would otherwise be leaving bites all over your body.Thataposs the thought process of one woman from Australia, who has been allowing a massive huntsman spider to live on the ceiling of her living room for around two weeks - and has even named him Simon. Posting anonymously on Reddit, the -year-old woman admitted Simon can sometimes freak out her house guests, and revealed she recently had trouble when she invited her friend and his arachnophobic girlfriend over to stay for a few days.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In her post, she said: I live in Sydney, where huntsman spiders are our common house spider. I’ve had onein my living room in the ceiling corner for about  weeks now. He’s hard to reach for me to trap and put outside, and honestly, he doesn’t bother me. He can chill there for as long as he wants so long as he keeps eating smaller bugs and so long as I can see him.A couple of weeks ago I had a friend named Ben and his girlfriend Shay stay over for a couple of nights. He lives in Melbourne, she’s from Wales and has only moved here recently. They’re travelling around Australia and Ben askedthey could stay at my place in Sydney as a favour. I was happy to do so! But I did warn him that there was a huntsman in my living room since I know foreigners can freak out about them. The woman insisted she warned the couple about Simonaposs presence, but her friendaposs girlfriend was still terried by the spider and demanded it be killed.  She claimed Shay called her f***ed up for keeping a spider in the house, but said she told her friendaposs girlfriend that she was doing them a favour by letting them stay here - so Simon wouldnapost be getting the chop because of them. She added: Shay and Ben got here and we were all having dinner and watching TV when Shay notices Simon chilling in the corner. She freaks out and says I need to kill it. I said no, I’m not comfortable killing spiders and he’s not hurting you. Apparently Ben hadn’t specied how big huntsman spiders are and Shay didn’t know. Shay kept telling us we needed to kill it. I said I didn’t want to, huntsman spiders are harmless and timid and they actually eat mosquitoes and other bugs you would rather not have in here. I askedshe had a phobia of spiders, she said spiders are fine but having one inside the house is f***ed up. I got kind of mad at that because I’m doing her a favour letting her stay for free, cooking for her etc and she’s calling me f***ed up for not killing a harmless creature.  I said, aposI doubt he’s the only spider, he’s just the only one you can seeapos. This p***ed her off even more, which I obviously understand so I get I may be the asshole for that. As a compromise, the woman and her friend ended up capturing Simon in a container and setting him free outside - but Shay was still traumatised by the events and demanded she and Ben stay in a hotel instead. The woman said: In the end, Ben and I ended up getting a step ladder, trapping him and putting him outside. She was not happy with this either and said that I should have killed it after putting it outside. She basically called me an a**hole and gave me dirties the rest of the night. They ended up leaving a day early to stay in a aposclean hotelapos . This again rubbed me the wrong way because my house is clean, it just had a spider in it ! Commenters on the Reddit post were mostly on the womanaposs side, as although they acknowledged Shayaposs fear and discomfort, they also said her comments were unnecessary. One person said: I mean, I understand why they freak people out. I wouldnapost kill one but I wouldnapost want one lurking either. While another wrote: I understand her fear but her comments were so unnecessary. How would you even kill a huntsman  Theyaposre like the size of dinner plates. While I would NOPE out of that house very quickly, she was told about the spider. She could have gotten it herselfshe wanted. She also continued to be an asshole after you had done what she wanted. Thataposs not on you, a third stated.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Umm what RedditSpiders" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i mum meet baby behind
story: I let my mum meet my baby behind my wes back - shes furious as she told me to waitA man has landed himself in hot water after he snuck his mum into his house to meet his newborn baby - after his we explicitly said she wasnt ready for guestsThe new mum is furious at her husband for going behind her backImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |commentsWhen a family member welcomes a child into the world, it can be tempting to try and see the bundle of joy as soon as possible - especiallythe arrival marks your first grandchild.But for the new mum who has given birth, the process of adjusting to le with a baby in the house can be a tough one, and it can sometimes take weeks before sheaposs ready to have guests come over to see the little one. And thataposs exactly what landed one man on Reddit in some severely hot water, as his we specically told him to wait before he invited his mother over to meet their baby - but he went behind her back and snuck his mum into the house. The man explained in his post that his mum had wanted to be in the delivery room but had reluctantly agreed to stay away when his we said she wasnapost comfortable having her there.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. His mum was then supposed to meet the baby at home, but after complications with the birth, the manaposs we was clearly exhausted so asked that her mother-in-law wait a few weeks before coming over. He wrote: My we recently gave birth to a beautul baby boy. He is the first kid in many years in my family and everyone was really excited about his birth, especially my mother. She wanted to be there in the delivery room with us but my we said no so I respected her wishes. I said she can meet him when we get home and my we agreed. Well, there were some complications in the birth and my we was clearly exhausted. In her exhaustion, she told me that maybe my mother waiting at the house isnapost a good idea, and said can I ask her to come after a couple of weeks. I was shocked and hurt. My mother loves my we and here my we was trying to intentionally hurt my mother. But seeing her in pain I couldnapost say no and called my mother. She was very upset.  A week after the birth of their son, the man asked againhis mum could visit and his we simply told him to wait. But instead of listening to the mother of his child, the man decided to go behind her back and invite his mum over anyway - specically when his we had left the house for a doctoraposs appointment. He added: A week goes by without any events. I asked my we again and again when can my mom come but she told me to wait. Yesterday my we went to a doctoraposs appointment and I was in charge of taking care of my son. Suddenly I got an idea and called my mother who lives nearby.  She came and met my son. The happiness that I saw on her face was amazing. It was an emotional moment for me when she held him for the first time. When the new mum came home and saw her mother-in-law she was furious, and exploded at her husband once his mother had left. He explained: She was just getting ready to leave but then my we arrived. She got very angry very fast. She didnapost say anything to my mother but I could see in her face that there was some rant coming. My mother left and my we exploded. I have never seen her this angry. She told meshe didnapost even invite her own mother then I shouldaposve understood that there was a reason. She was especially upset about me doing this behind her back. I said I am sorry multiple times but she is still angry. I slept in the guest room yesterday. I donapost think I did anything a good son wouldnapost do, but I do feel bad about hurting my we. Comments on the Reddit post were firmly on the new mumaposs side, as many of them pointed out that he should have listened to his we and respected her need to heal following the birth of their son. One person said: Your we would have told you when she was ready to introduce your son to your mother. You kept pushing and then went behind your we’s back. While another added: You prioritised being a good son over being a good husband and father. You and your mother put your own feelings ahead of your we who is recovering from a traumatic birth. news weird-news peoples-minds-blown-discover-little-"TikTok user discovers meaning behind Domino’s boxByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsA woman was left gobsmacked when she realised why there are dots on the top of the Dominoaposs boxes.TikTok user Molly, who goes by @mlly.ch on the , posted a video of the moment she and her friend made the discovery after ordering two pizzas from the restaurant chain.In a video that has been viewed more than . million times, the girls could be seen visibly stunned as they put the two boxes together and found out that the two dots on each one made a domino. Bro why am I only learning today that the dominos boxes MAKE A DOMINO, she wrote over the clip. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Mind blown, she captioned the video. Molly added in a pinned comment on the clip: The two boxes put together make one domino that’s what I’m trying to relay. If that wasn’t clear. Since being posted, the video has racked up almost , likes and  comments from people who admitted that they too had no idea what the dots were for until Molly pointed it out.Bruh the whole time   I thought those were an aerial view of sumo wrestlers, one person wrote. Another commented: I literally worked there and had no idea. I actually said the oh my god on the second one at the same time as my reaction, said a third. This comes as another Dominoaposs fan shared a replica recipe for the famous garlic and herb dip. Not only is the recipe super quick and easy, but itaposs also slightly healthier than the original dip which is said to have  calories in a single size serving, whilst the large pot contains almost  calories. To make the dip, all you need to do is combine half a cup of sour cream, half a cup of mayo, a teaspoon of oregano, a tablespoon of white wine vinegar, half a teaspoon of garlic puree, a pinch of salt and a pinch of sugar in a bowl and mix well. Pop it in the fridge to chill for a couple of hours whilst you wait for your pizza, then serve. Give it a try and seeit competes with the real thing.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news teen-mobility-scooter-filmed-towing-"Wales: Mobility scooter driver spotted towing caravanByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments A teenager had drivers in hysterics when he was spotted casually riding a mobility scooter on a road pulling a caravan behind him. The mystery driver was seen crossing a junction in front of other cars as he towed the portable home in his wake. The bizarre scene was filmed by Casey Hulme in north Wales, who joked on Facebook : “I can’t believe what I’ve just witnessed.“Only in Rhyl.” Her video has since been viewed .million times and had , shares by incredulous people.Casey, , told Mail Online : “I was on my way home with my friend and I saw the boy on the mobility scooter trying to pull out of a junction.“aposI turned the car around and we parked on a street off the main road the guy was going down with the caravan and watched them go past.aposI think my reaction on the video speaks for itself. We were crying with laughter.apos Thousands of people have commented on her original post. One said: “This will be me with the BMWthese prices keep on going up.” Another joked: “This is what happens when you expect to go away for a weekend and you donapost want to take the car because of the fuel prices.” Another said: “I really need to know how this ended. “I mean heaposs going to stop - but that caravan isn’t.”  The Government’s website says drivers do not need a licence for a mobility scooter but only certain types can be driven on roads. It is not the first time mobility scooters have been seen holding up traffic. Last year in Manchester a rider held up “more than  cars” by refusing to pull over in a one-way street as he waited for his chippy tea to be brought out, prompting honks from “irate” motorists.Bizarre footage of the incident shows the hungry customer parked up in the centre of the road in Manchester city centre last Friday, blocking a large truck and the cars behind from passing. Multiple people were seen attempting to help or intervene, only for the stubborn man to repeatedly shout “I just want the fish and chips that Iaposve paid for”. Passerby David Williams had presumed the battery on the manaposs scooter was flat so went over to seehe could help but was told to “back off” by the scooter user.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON VehiclesMobility scooterTeenagers" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. after meeting an adorable dog in the street wearing exactly the same jumper as her.Sharing the aposmagicalapos moment on TikTok, Carmen MacLeod says she began to tear up when she saw the pooch sporting the same blue jumper with fluffy white clouds on.The clip, which has already racked in , views, was accompanied with the message: There are no words to describe what just happened, other than GOD IS GOOD.Carmen, who has , followers on her TikTok page aposCreatively Carmen Artapos, got her jumper is from the brand Shien. to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.In the video, she says: So donapost mind me shaking because Iaposm still processing what just happened to me, but I just need to show you, there are no words. I met a dog today who was wearing the same sweater as me. In what world does this happen  A really good world. Carmen, who works as an artist and travelling muralist, petted the dog, named Angel, before arranging a meet up with her owner. She added: The owner and I are even getting coffee together. Amazed by the coincidence, users have been commenting on the unlikely encounter, with TikTok followers telling her thataposs your soulmate and that she officially lives in a Disney Pixar movie. Another TikTok user remarked: My dream encounter! Market research consultants Million Insights said that the dog clothing industry is expected to reach USD . billion by . A Million Insights statement reads: The growing awareness about petsapos health and wellbeing, coupled with the stringent government regulations for better care of animals in many countries is likely to drive the demand for dog accessories. The rise in the number of pet ownership and the increase in the availability of a wide range of accessories for dogs for their well-being are expected to remain favourable factors for the industry growth. Advancements in the pet clothing and accessories industry, coupled with the wide availability of pet accessories and increasing disposable income in developing countries, have led to increasing pet grooming expenditure. news weird-news woman-shares--second-shaving-"Woman shares leg-shaving hack after doing it wrong for yearsByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |comments Shaving can feel like a chore, especially now weaposre heading into shorts weather and you canapost skip days as you did in the winter. But one woman has shared a hack that cuts the shaving time in half.Lauren Henderson said her aposle was forever changedapos after she came across a technique on TikTok that guarantees silky smooth skin in just apos secondsapos.Keen to share it with others, Lauren, who goes by the name of @lalalalauren on the , demonstrated the hack in a video that has racked up more than . million views.She captioned the post: Who freaking knew  Cause I didn’t. Thank you girl on TikTok—I am forever changed! For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. She said: Yaposall I have got to show you a le hack that I learned on TikTok. Does anybody  learn so much about le on TikTok or is it just me  I wish I could remember the girl that posted this video but I saw it and it has forever changed me. If you shave your legs, listen up. You know how we lather our legs up and we shave and we shave and we do all that, right  Wrong!Try this instead. Shave but don’t lt it. Shave but don’t lt it. It literally took me five seconds per leg to shave my legs this morning. That is the fastest it’s ever taken me in my le and you can go over your knees too and it won’t cut you up. She also added in the comments that she uses soap and lathers well before she begins shaving. Yes—lather with whatever you use! she said. I used soap. I was just showing y’all how to do it without literally being in the shower.Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and , comments from people who were keen to try it out for themselves. One person said: Iaposve learned more on TikTok in one year than my whole  years of le combined. Another wrote: I tried it out of curiosity and it really does work just in case anyone is hesitant. No cuts nothing but smooth legs.Iaposve been shaving this way for over  years, but legit thought it was just my lazy method haha, commented a third. Someone  said: For the st time in my le I can’t wait to shave tomorrow morning. However, one user who claimed to have tried it out for themselves didnapost have the best experience, as they said: Tried this and my legs have broken out in a rash and are unbearably itchy so maybe not a hackyou have sensitive skin.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: woman told job interview fantastic
story: Woman told job interview was fantastic - but is rejected due to strong Welsh accentA woman has shared a rejection email she received following a job interview in which shes told recruiters thought she was fantastic but she wasnt being hired due to her strong Welsh accentEluneds tweet has gone viral Image: Eluned Anderson Media WalesByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsNo form of rejection is ever easy to take, but some are certainly more dficult to handle than others. And one woman has had peopleaposs jaws dropping as she shared a look at a rejection email she was sent following a recent job interview.Eluned Anderson from Cardf took to social media to share a screenshot of the email in which she was told that recruiters at the company thought she was fantastic.They go on to say that she performed very well and that her skillset would reflect well in the role. However, things take a turn as you keep reading, as they ultimately decide not to offer Eluned the position due to her strong Welsh accent and regional activities. Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Alongside the email, the -year-old who is a regional ambassador for Holocaust UK, wrote: First time Iaposve ever been told Iaposve got a strong Welsh accent, so I suppose thataposs a win  The full email reads: Hi Ellie, Thank you so much for your time in applying for the role of [job title removed] and attending the interview at such short notice. We thought you were fantastic and performed well throughout. Your skillset would reflect well in the role. Iaposm sorry to say, however, that we have decided not to proceed with your application. It was decided that your strong Welsh accent, accompanied by your regional activities, would not suit the office environment. Thanks once again for your interest and time. Thousands of people have liked, shared and replied to the tweet, with many pointing out that Eluned is being discriminated against.Under the Equality Act , it is against the law to discriminate against anyone because of their race, including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin.One person said: I think youaposll find that reply furnishes you with a strong claim for employment discrimination. Seriously - take advice. Another wrote: I am sorry what      This is WILDLY not okay ! A third responded: If theyaposre doing that, what  are they discriminating against  Iaposm stunned. This is horrible and definitely discrimination under the Equality Act, added Deeba Syed, an employment lawyer, who went on to offer a chat. Similarly, Jamie Hanley of Trade Union Law offered to have his team take a look at the matter on behalf of Eluned.Do you have a story to share  We pay for stories. title: freakish heatwaves both earths poles
story: Freakish heatwaves at both of Earths poles leaves climate scientists baffledData from the Antarctic showed on average the continent was around .C warmer than recorded between  and  while the Arctic was up .C, leaving experts baffledTemperatures in the Antarctic reached record levels Image: Getty ImagesByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsClimate scientists have been left baffled after both of Earth’s poles reported “freakish” heatwaves at the same time last weekend.Weather stations in the Antarctic showed parts of the frozen southern pole was as high as C warmer than average at -.C at Concordia station, setting a new record for this time of the year.Records were also shattered at Vostok station where the mercury was as high as -.C.Meanwhile at the north pole the Arctic was nearing or at melting point, taking watching scientists in the US by surprise.The situation is made all the more bizarre by the fact the poles are in dferent seasons and do not warm at the same time.Ice scientist Walt Meier told phys.org : “Itaposs pretty stunning.“They are opposite seasons. You donapost see the north and the southboth melting at the same time.  Itaposs definitely an unusual occurrence. University of Wisconsin meteorologist Matthew Lazzara added: “Not a good sign when you see that sort of thing happen. “Thataposs a temperature that you should see in January, not March. January is summer there. “Thataposs dramatic. The experts believe the unusual event is a random weather event rather than a concerning sign of global warming, unless it happens regularly. The University of Maineaposs Climate Reanalyzer showed the Antarctic was around .C warmer than usual while the Arctic was .C higher. Michael Mann, director of the Earth System Science Centre at Pennsylvania State University, told the: “The warming of the Arctic and Antarctic is cause for concern, and the increase in extreme weather events – of which these are an example – is a cause for concern as well.“The models have done a good job projecting the overall warming, but we’ve argued that extreme events are exceeding model projections. “These events drive home the urgency of action.” Meanwhile Italian scientists are hoping to study and take samples from Europeaposs southernmost glacier before it melts and disappears as a result of rising global temperatures. Researchers conducted a preliminary radar survey of the Calderone glacier in Italyaposs central Apennine Mountains on March  and plan tonext month to drill into it and take samples. The aim is to extract chunks of the glacier and store them in Antarctica for future study. Researcher Jacopo Gabrieli, from the Institute of Polar Sciences at the Italian National Council of Research, said: “This glacier can tell us the Mediterraneanaposs climate and environmental history. news world-news friends-beg-vladimir-putins-lover-"Tokyo : Alina Kabaeva slams judges over Averina decisionByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsFriends of Vladimir Putinaposs alleged lover have begged her to go to Moscow and persuade him to end the war, it is claimed.Former gymnast Alina Kabaeva is believed to be holed up in a luxury mountain mansion in Switzerland as calls mount for her to be expelled.The -year-old, who is rumoured to have four children with the Russian President, is not among the figures close to Putin who are facing sanctions. Pals are said to be hopeful that Kabaeva can persuade him to bring the bloodshed to an end.A source told Page Six : “Alina’s female friends are begging her to fly to Putin and persuade him to end the war.“He doesn’t seem to be listening to anybody, but perhaps he might listen to her.” But the insider claimed Kabaeva is fearful about how Putin will reactshe voices any opposition to the conflict. They said that the president is surrounded by rings and rings of security, adding: Alina says she doesn’t knowshe can get to him – and evenshe does – she doesn’t knowshe’ll be able to get out again to be with their kids.” The West has so far not sanctioned Kabaeva - although as well as being Putin’s rumoured secret partner, she is also chairman of the board of directors at National Media Group, a major Kremlin-obedient TV and newspaper behemoth, at a salary of almost £ million a year. A petition signed by nearly , people likens her with Eva Braun, Hitleraposs mistress.It says: “It’s time you reunite Eva Braun with her Führer. And it continues: “Despite the current war, Switzerland continues to host an accomplice of Putin’s regime. “The public has just learned that the Russian political and media figure, and former [rhythmic gymnast], Alina Kabaeva, is hiding the consequences of the sanctions imposed on the Russian Federation in your country.“She is the favourite we of [the] delusional dictator and war criminal who has been treacherously attacking Ukraine over the past weeks. “As she is supportive of social activities in Russia, she has been attempting to get Russian citizens accustomed to the reality of sanctions after , and personally proclaimed: ‘The worse it gets, the better for us!’”The signatories question why “given the volume of sanctions placed on Russia” the authorities continue to host her and her family at a time when Putin “is destroying the lives of millions”. The petition continues: For the first time in modern history, your country has violated its neutrality, which it did not even do vis-à-vis Nazi Germany in the th century, and joined the sanctions against Putin and his surroundings. “And now you are allowing his favourite mistress and her children to hide within the borders of your state.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Eva BraunVladimir PutinRussia Ukraine war" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: how dare anyone criticise nazanin
story: How dare anyone criticise Nazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe, who was left to rot in IranPolly Hudson is disgusted by the trolls, after Nazanin was berated simply for addressing the elephant in the room, and she says Boris Johnson has got off lightlyNazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe and husband Richard at the press conference Image: PAopinionByPolly Hudson:,  Mar |commentsThe incredible thing is that she had every right to rant and rage furiously, scream, wail, and spew venom about the hideous injustice she’s ­suffered, the torture and ­separation she’s endured. Instead, at a press conference on Monday, Nazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe calmly explained that she’d found it hard to trust foreign secretaries after so many let her down. “What’s happened now should have happened six years ago. I shouldn’t have been in prison for six years,” she said, not even raising her voice. Within hours, the appalling hashtags #sendherback and #ungrateful were trending on Twitter. Angela from Worcestershire called in to Channel ’s The Jeremy Vine Show to say: “For her, now she’s back, in her first interview, to turn round and blame our ­government is an ungrateful thing to do.”Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section Jason from Milborne Port agreed on Nick Ferrari’s LBC radio show. “It would have been nice for her to say thank you,” he moaned.For the record, the first words out of Nazanin ’s mouth at the press conference were: “I would like to begin by saying that I am very grateful to whoever has been involved in getting us home, from politicians, to media members, whoever has been trying very hard to get our voices heard.”She then gave a long list of thank yous. She used the word “grateful” so many times I lost count. But because she didn’t just sit prettily in front of the cameras and smile appreciatively, because this woman who has lost six years of her le – her marriage, her daughter’s childhood – dared address the elephant in the room, she’s now being berated. It’s outrageous, insulting, misogynistic. Cheer up, love – OK, it did happen, but you’re home now so count yourself lucky. She didn’t even mention Boris Johnson, whose ­incompetence when he was the foreign secretary tasked with helping her sealed her fate further instead. He wrongly announced she was “teaching people journalism” – a statement that days later was cited in Iranian court proceedings as proof she was engaged in ­“propaganda against the regime”. It’s something that must surely have played on her mind every now and then as she sat in her cell for years and years and years.Heroic MP Tulip Siddiq, who worked tirelessly to free her constituent, revealed this week that, “This disastrous blunder meant Johnson was forced to meet us. Incredibly, he askedRichard had enjoyed his visit to Iran.“Anyone who had read a newspaper article on the case was aware that Richard had been at home in the UK when his we was arrested in Iran. To this day, I feel astonished by Johnson’s extremely poor grasp of his brief. ” The simple truth is that Nazanin has a lot to be angry about. She was an innocent pawn in a game between two governments arguing over a £million debt for a cancelled arms deal. She was held for ransom, and left to rot. Then, six long years later, the Tories who run this country may need Iranian oil, so they suddenly decide to do the right thing and rescue her… and she’s supposed to be grateful  Are you kidding  Jeremy Hunt, one of the other foreign secretaries who failed her said yesterday: “Those criticising Nazanin have got it so wrong. She doesn’t owe us gratitude: we owe her an explanation.” Too right.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ParentingNazanin Zaghari-RatclfeIranWomen" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: putins troops plant mines prepare
story: Putins troops plant mines as they prepare for long war of attrition in UkraineVladimir Putins Russian war machine is feared to be strengthening the positions it has gained around the Ukrainian capital Kyiv and other parts of the countryMultiple explosions and rising smoke are seen around an industrial compound in Mariupol in this screengrab from a video released on March  Image: via REUTERSByTom ParrySpecial correspondent:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russian forces are planting mines around areas they have seized as they prepare for a “long war” of attrition in Ukraine, new images show.The Institute for the Study of War, a US think tank, says Russian troops are strengthening their positions around the periphery of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, and in other parts of the country.Nearly a month after the invading army first crossed the border, the lightning advance which Vladimir Putin anticipated has failed to materialise.Now latest satellite footage shows troops digging trenches and fortications around military equipment northwest of Kyiv.With a stalemate unfolding in key battlegrounds, Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky today asked the Pope to intervene in the conflict. Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletinhere  In a call with Pope Francis, he askedthe Catholic Church could play a “mediating role”. The president said he discussed the “dficult humanitarian situation and the blocking of rescue corridors by Russian troops.” So far the Kremlin has not responded to the Vatican’s numerous offers to help set up negotiations. President Zelensky also addressed the Italian parliament and referred to his y conversation with the Pope. Meanwhile Ukrainian officials said Moscow has lost its “offensive potential” and is being forced to call in reinforcements from the “depths” of Russia as it retreats in key battles.It said some troops are deserting, forcing generals to take drastic decisions. The Ukraine armed forces said Russian troops had been “repelled” from Makariv, a strategically important Kyiv suburb, and the Ukrainian flag was raised over the town “thanks to the heroic actions of our defenders”. The recapture of Makariv, about  miles west of Kyiv, could prevent Russian forces from encircling the capital from the northwest.  It comes as a senior Ukrainian general has claimed that the Kremlin is preparing its population for a “long war” and implementing draconian mobilisation measures, including deploying members of the youth military organisation, who are aged between  and . Officials claim , Russian soldiers have died so far, although these figures cannot be veried. Saboteurs sent into Ukraine at the beginning of the conflict continue to be caught. They include a man disguised as a monk who was detained in Kyiv, First Deputy Interior Minister Yevhen Yenin revealed last night.“The enemy is using ious cover-ups,” he revealed. “A saboteur dressed in monastic clothes has been detained in Kyiv. Instructions, photos of checkpoints, military facilities and calls to Russia have been found on his phone.”In Britain, the Ministry of Defence said Russian forces have “endured yet another day of limited progress, with most forces largely stalled in place”.The Ukrainian military also claims the invading army only has stockpiles of ammunition and food to last for “no more than three days”. And a senior US defence official said a lack of correct equipment has led to some soldiers suffering from frostbite. It says the operation to take over Ukraine is being mobilised “chaotically”, leading to increasingly desperate tactics seen in the southern cities and around the capital Kyiv.US President Joe Biden warned that Putin might resort to biological and chemical weapons as his “back is against the wall”.He believes the Russian leadership is prepared to carry out so-called “ flag” operations to justy its propaganda, including that America actually has chemical weapons ready to be launched in Europe. “They are also suggesting that Ukraine has biological and chemical weapons in Ukraine,” he went on. “That’s a clear sign he’s considering using both of those. He’s already used chemical weapons in the past, and we should be careful of what’s about to come.” Putin “knows there’ll be severe consequences because of the united Nato front,” he added, without specying what actions the alliance would take. President Biden also confirmed that Russia has used hypersonic missiles against key targets in Ukraine.  Kyiv’s deputy head of police has accused Russian forces of using white phosphorus in the city of Kramatorsk, in the northern part of Donetsk. Oleksiy Biloshytskiy shared a clip of a substance releasing white smoke into the air as it burned on the ground. Mr Biloshytskiy wrote: “Another use of phosphorus ammunitions in Kramatorsk.” White phosphorus is a toxic substance that is self-igniting when it interacts with oxygen.In a signal of how willing Russia is to target its firepower on civilians, Ukraine’s Health Minister Viktor Lyashko said ten hospitals have now been completely destroyed since Russia invaded Ukraine.He said others could not be restocked with medicines and supplies. Despite signicant Ukrainian resistance, the mayor of Boryspil city near Kyiv has told residents to “leave town ASAP” as fighting against Russian forces draws closer. title: relief ukranians reunite after escaping
story: Exclusive: Relief as Ukranians reunite after escaping Mariupol bloodshedMaryna Boreiko, , got word on Friday that her mother and -year-old grandmother were still alive after Russian troops bombarded the coastal cityMaryna Boreiko and her boyfriend Serhii Rozhkov drove for  hours to rescue her mum PolinaByAlex Lloyd:,  Mar |commentsUkranians with family trapped in war-ravaged Mariupol have told of their relief at finding out they are alive and have escaped the bloodshed. Up to , civilians are believed to have died since Russian troops encircled, besieged and bombarded the coastal city, with bodies lying on the streets and children dying of thirst. Trapped residents have been running out of food and water, with an estimated , people living without heating or electricity. Last week, small groups started to flee in cars and risk losing their lives during the escape, rather than face death by staying. Maryna Boreiko, , got word on Friday that her mother and -year-old grandmother were still alive after losing contact on March . Her boyfriend Serhii Rozhkov drove for  hours to rescue Maryna’s mum Polina Boreiko and his own parents from the ravaged city, with the group taking shelter in Berdynask  miles away. The mother and daughter were finally reunited on Sunday.  She said: “My grandmother has had to stay, she cannot manage such a dangerous road. She is staying with my cousin. He is a nurse, which makes me calmer. “My brother and his we also got out of Mariupol. They are in a village nearby as they ran out of gas. “They haven’t been able to tell me much about conditions in Mariupol because they are afraid of being overheard by Russian occupiers. Maryna and her boyfriend fled their home in Kharkiv when it was hit by shelling the day war broke out, taking refuge at a friend’s empty flat in Kryvyi Rig. But the Mariupol natives had advised their families to stay put and not panic. The marketing specialist said: “I’m blaming myself. I could have insisted they leave Mariupol the day the war started. Instead I said to them it will be okay, donapost panic.  And my mummy didnapost panic. In the first days of the war, she even went to work. “She works with small organisations that supply stories with essentials. And she was joking: aposIf I leave the city, then who will take orders for toilet paper apos Now this joke doesnapost seem funny to me.” Maryna is still anxiously waiting for news of her -year-old goddaughter Lera and her family however. She said: I’m afraid my goddaughter could be in the drama theatre that was bombed. Her family lived nearby.” Maryna has a treasured picture of herself with the schoolgirl in a square that has been completely destroyed by bombs. She said: I donapost care about the square but I am afraid to think my sweet girl might not be alive any more. Her friend Veronica Vishnevski also lost direct contact with her extended family on March  but got word on Friday that her mother Lilia Maltseva, , was alive.Russian-born Lilia’s last words to her had been: “Care only about Ukraine, donapost think about me too much.”She said: “My mum told me she escaped from our district on March , because Ukrainian soldiers came to civilians and said that the district could be harshly bombed. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter “She wrote that our district is completely destroyed, she doesn’t have a place to live in and Russia hit a building nearby with an air bomb.“One lady could not escape because her husband has a disability. “They spent the night in a village occupied by Russia. They met adorable Ukrainian people, who fed them and treated them really good. “My family tried to pay for food and bed, but the hosts started crying. “Mum said she was extremely exhausted and also wanted to have a bath as she has been two weeks without a shower.” Her mum has now moved onto Dnipro,  miles north-west of Mariupol.  Veronica and her husband Anton, who is Ukrainian Jewish, emigrated to Israel four months ago without knowing war would come to their homeland. Her mum is a retired electrician who was widowed  years ago and is travelling with her sister-in-law Natalia and nephew Fedor, as her brother Ilia is a sailor and on a ship in Mississippi. “We’ve discussed it and my mum has agreed to live in Israel, as it is possible for family members to come here,” she said. “My friends still don’t know anything about their parents. I don’t know why I am so lucky. “I hope that all Mariupol citizens will find a way from this hell. And all Ukrainians are looking forward to the end of Putinaposs war.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON SoldiersRussia Ukraine warUkraine crisis" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: terrifying regime putins replacement who
story: Terrying regime of Putin’s ’replacement’ who poisoned his own KGB spy-year-old spymaster Alexander Bortnikov has come under scrutiny after it was claimed that there was a plot to oust Putin, and replace him with a close ruthless allySpymaster Alexander Bortnikov Image: AFP Getty ImagesByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsFrom being accused of poisoning his own spy to recently falling out with Putin, ex-KGB spy Alexander Bortnikov has lived a terrying le.Itaposs been claimed that ruthless figure could replace Vladimir Putin - after elite Russians reportedly hatched up a plan to oust the brutal director. Ukrainian intelligence officials claimed yesterday to have discovered a plot to remove Putin from his presidency, over fears that economic sanctions will cripple the country.The elite circle in Moscow is said to fear that the countryaposs brutal war could lead to further ramications for them. Now they are reportedly considering a range of options to replace him - including faking an accident or poisoning the brutal leader. His former friend Alexander Bortnikov, who was previously sanctioned by the US, is said to be in the running to replace him.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here  He is the current director of Russiaaposs FSB - a role previously held by Putin - and was regarded as an influential member of the Presidentaposs small inner circle. Bortnikov previously served in the KGB and met Putin while they were both stationed in Leningrad - now Saint Petersburg - in the s. Since being appointed to the top role in , he is said to rule with an iron fist, to ensure Putinaposs regime continues. The shadowy organisation - which Putin relies on for all his intelligence - is at the heart of the Russian government, with Dossier Center describing it as a “state within the state. After Putin became President, he appointed Bortnikov as the head of Russiaaposs Economic Security Service, where he wielded a huge amount of power. In , it was claimed that Bortnikov allegedly oversaw the operation to assassinate Alexander Litvinenko on British soil. The agency is also believed to be responsible for the poisoning of Alexei Navalny under Mr Bortnikov’s order. Russia and Bortnikov deny any involvement in the deaths.  And in , Bortnikov was accused of holding a pro-Stalin attitude, after a group of academics claimed he was legitimising the mass purges carried out under Joseph Stalin, which were dubbed the Great Terror. At the time, he told a paper that archives showed that a signicant part of the criminal cases of those killed had an objective side to them.Now intelligence agents claim powerful figures in Russia have chosen the spymaster as they believe he can help restore economic ties with the West. Their goal is to remove Putin from power as soon as possible and restore economic ties with the West, destroyed due to the war in Ukraine, the Defence Intelligence of Ukraine said.It is known that Bortnikov and some other influential representatives of the Russian elite are considering ious options to remove Putin from power. In particular, poisoning, sudden disease, or any other ‘coincidence’ is not excluded. Itaposs thought the relationship between Putin and Bortnikov has become strained - with the spymaster blamed for allowing his military commanders to be overwhelmed by the fierce Ukrainian defence. Putin is said to be displeased with the FSB thanks to failures with the intelligence secured during the war. Deputy Vyacheslav Ushakov has already been sacked. One intelligence source told the Mirror: It is noteworthy that Bortnikov has recently been disgraced by the Russian dictator. “The official reason for the disgrace of the FSB leader – fatal miscalculations in the war against Ukraine. “Bortnikov and his department were responsible for analysing the mood of Ukraine and the ability of the Ukrainian army.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Alexander BortnikovJoe BidenAlexander LitvinenkoJoseph StalinDmitry MedvedevVladimir PutinBritish ArmyThe Washington Post CompanyArmed forcesShopping centres" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
